docs.snippet: The Supreme Court’s temporary stay of the Clean Power Plan underscores the vulnerability of America’s pledges to the world....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court’s temporary stay of the Clean Power Plan underscores the vulnerability of America’s pledges to the world.
docs.abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column observes Supreme Court's decision to delay implementation of Pres Obama's Clean Power Plan underscores how administration's climate change promises to international community are vulnerable to domestic politics; observes that even if plan were allowed to go forward and it worked without hitch, United States would still fail to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by as much as has been promised.

headline.main: Next Supreme Court Justice Will Be Crucial to Climate Change

docs.snippet: The president echoed themes from his campaign announcement in 2007, when he pledged to improve the bitter divisions that still split Washington....
docs.lead_paragraph: The president echoed themes from his campaign announcement in 2007, when he pledged to improve the bitter divisions that still split Washington.
docs.abstract: Pres Obama returns to Illinois General Assembly on ninth anniversary of beginning his White House campaign there, delivering address that concedes his failed promise to lift politics above partisan rancor; obliquely criticizes both extreme conservatives and progressives in 2016 election and argues political reconciliation is necessary for health and survival of nation.

headline.main: Obama Revisits Springfield, and His Vow to Bridge a Partisan Divide
headline.print_headline: Obama Revisits Springfield, and His Vow to Bridge Partisan Rift

docs.snippet: The president submitted his last spending plan to a hostile Republican-led Congress. New initiatives include $19 billion for a cybersecurity plan....
docs.lead_paragraph: The president submitted his last spending plan to a hostile Republican-led Congress. New initiatives include $19 billion for a cybersecurity plan.
docs.abstract: Pres Obama transmits his last annual budget proposal to Republican-controlled Congress; budget would would surpass $4 trillion for 2017 fiscal year, with $19 billion allocated to  cybersecurity and 25 percent to discretionary spending for domestic and military programs to be negotiated; budget forecasts rise in deficit in current fiscal year to $616 billion from $438 billion, in part because of agreement between Obama and Congress to make some tax cuts permanent.

headline.main: Obama’s Last Budget, and Last Budget Battle With Congress
headline.print_headline: For Obama, One Last Budget, and One Last Budget Battle With Congress

docs.snippet: The lush California estate where President Obama plans to welcome Asian leaders next week — and maybe play some golf — has historically been a Republican retreat....
docs.lead_paragraph: The lush California estate where President Obama plans to welcome Asian leaders next week — and maybe play some golf — has historically been a Republican retreat.
docs.abstract: White House Letter; Pres Obama increasingly uses Sunnylands estate near Palm Springs, Calif, which was favored retreat for series of Republican presidents; golf course is a major attraction for president, who frequently hosts meetings with world leaders there.

headline.main: Obama Revives the Republican Glory Years of Sunnylands Estate
headline.print_headline: Obama Revives G.O.P. Glory Years of Sunnylands

docs.snippet: The first time the president met with House Democrats, in 2009, there were 257 of them. Now there are 188. Some point a finger at him....
docs.lead_paragraph: The first time the president met with House Democrats, in 2009, there were 257 of them. Now there are 188. Some point a finger at him.
docs.abstract: Pres Obama speaks at annual retreat for Democratics in House, who are unlikely to recapture majority in in 2016 elections; while Democratic House lawmakers continue to unite with Obama against Republicans, Democratic support of Obama's agenda has led to startling attrition in House ranks and Democrats can no longer force through any major legislation.

headline.main: For House Democrats, Support for Obama Agenda Came at a Cost
headline.print_headline: Diminished House Democrats Assess Cost of Backing the Obama Agenda

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

docs.snippet: Readers and rights activists discuss the Obama administration’s plans....
docs.lead_paragraph: Readers and rights activists discuss the Obama administration’s plans.

headline.main: As Refugees Flee Violence in Central America

docs.snippet: There’s nothing Orwellian about spin. It makes politics fun and engages the public....
docs.lead_paragraph: There’s nothing Orwellian about spin. It makes politics fun and engages the public.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof David Greenberg traces rise of 'spin' in American politics, from relatively straightforward politics of 1960s to modern convolutions; holds spin is good for democracy because it keeps citizens engaged, prompts examination and serves as reminder that politics are never entirely truthful.

headline.main: Why Spin Is Good for Democracy
headline.print_headline: Why Spin Is Good for Democracy

byline.contributor: David Greenberg, a professor of history and of journalism and media studies at Rutgers, is the author of “Republic of Spin: An Inside History of the American Presidency.”

docs.snippet: The text of the president’s State of the Union address, as prepared for delivery Tuesday night....
docs.lead_paragraph: The text of the president’s State of the Union address, as prepared for delivery Tuesday night.

headline.main: Transcript of Obama’s 2016 State of the Union Address

docs.snippet: Readers respond to articles on extremism, gun laws, Islam and how to teach the classics....
docs.lead_paragraph: Readers respond to articles on extremism, gun laws, Islam and how to teach the classics.

docs.snippet: “Every time I think about those kids, it gets me mad,” the president said, discussing the victims of the Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting....
docs.lead_paragraph: “Every time I think about those kids, it gets me mad,” the president said, discussing the victims of the Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting.
docs.abstract: Pres Obama, in tearful and emotion-laden speech, condemns shootings that have swept America and vows to curb gun violence with or without Congress's cooperation; Obama faces numerous logistical, legal and political barriers to executive actions he has planned, which are limited in scope, and administration admits it is difficult to gauge potential effect of proposed steps.

headline.main: Tearful Obama Outlines Steps to Curb Gun Deaths
headline.print_headline: Tearful Obama Outlines Steps to Curb Gun Deaths

byline.original: By ERIC LICHTBLAU and MICHAEL D. SHEAR
